member.summary: This class allows the application author to add post/rollback event support to command handler control flow. member.summary:
A marker interface that allows the command/query class to add correlation decorator context event after control flow. In the class handling the query or command, you should reference the and set the and/or .
Note that will be raised at the end of the control only if there is no exception, giving you access to all data still alive on the control flow and the will only be raised when exception. The exception in that case in accessible through the .

member.name: M:Xpandables.Net.Disposable.Dispose
member.summary: Public Implementation of Dispose according to .NET Framework Design Guidelines callable by consumers. Do not make this method virtual. A derived class should not be able to override this method.

remarks.para: This object will be cleaned up by the Dispose method. Therefore, you should call GC.SuppressFinalize to take this object off the finalization queue and prevent finalization code for this object from executing a second time.
Always use SuppressFinalize() in case a subclass of this type implements a finalizer.

member.name: M:Xpandables.Net.Disposable.DisposeAsync
member.summary: Public Implementation of DisposeAsync according to .NET Framework Design Guidelines callable by consumers. Do not make this method virtual. A derived class should not be able to override this method.

remarks.para: This object will be cleaned up by the Dispose method. Therefore, you should call GC.SuppressFinalize to take this object off the finalization queue and prevent finalization code for this object from executing a second time.
Always use SuppressFinalize() in case a subclass of this type implements a finalizer.

member.name: M:Xpandables.Net.Disposable.DisposeAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Protected implementation of Dispose pattern. When overridden in derived classes, this method get called when the instance will be disposed.
member.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

remarks.list:
executes in two distinct scenarios.
If equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed.
If equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.name: T:Xpandables.Net.EntityFramework.IPersistenceDecorator
member.summary: A marker interface that allows the command handler class implementation to use persistence data across the control flow. The behavior makes use of an implementation of in the handler class implementation to persist data at the end of the control flow only if there is no exception. In order to control the behavior, you can add the to the command/query class and reference the in the handler class implementation, to defines actions to be applied after the control flow with on success and on exception.

member.name: T:Xpandables.Net.EntityFramework.QueryPersistenceDecorator`2
member.summary: This class allows the application author to add persistence support to query control flow. The target command should implement the interface in order to activate the behavior. The class decorates the target command handler with an implementation of and executes the the after the main one in the same control flow only if there is no exception. You can set the with the command, in order to manage the exception.

member.summary:
Contains the collection of resource types used to add localization for application page models (razor style). Each page is associated with a resource type name that matches the following the framework name convention. if a localization file is not defined, the default data annotation behavior is used.
Example : pageName.cshtml.cs contains the pageNameModel and the localization file is named pageNameLocalization.resx.
This behavior is available for the following attributes :
: (just set to any value) will be bounded to the as key in the resource file. (just set to any value) will be bounded to the as key in the resource file. (just set to any value) will be bound to the as key in the resource file.
: (just set to any value) will be bounded to the as key in the resource file. (just set to any value) will be bounded to the as key in the resource file.
You can use the class to build custom enumeration and use the tag helper that expects the enumeration value for localization in label and the enumeration value will be bound to the as key in the resource file.
You can use the for custom model binder and validator attributes for localization. You can use for single culture resource for all pages.
